com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Interface Content

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
FileContent, Folder, WritableContent, WritableFolder
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseContent, BaseFolder
public interface Content
extends Comparable, Serializable

This interface represents objects that can be accessed through a Connection. A Content object is a lightweight proxy representation of an object that exists within some external database or file system, for example a shapefile or a metadata document on an ArcIMS Metadata service.

The actual content object can possibly be exposed in different ways depending on its type, and the uses to which it can be put. For example, a Content that represents a shapefile dataset could be exposed as a FeatureClass or a FeatureLayer. Since a shapefile can also be considered as a FeatureDataset, it could also be exposed as a FeatureDataset, however, in practise, shapefiles are exposed as FeatureClass and FeatureLayer only, since these are probably the most useful GIS objects related to a shapefile.

That types that are exposed for a particular Content object, can be discovered using getAvailableContentTypes(). Once a particular content-type is chosen, you can obtain the corresponding object using getData() and specify the required content-type. If you request a content-type that is not available, then getData() will return null. You can also inquire if a particular content-type is available, using isContentTypeAvailable().

Content-types are defined by the full pathname of a Java class. For example, the FeatureDataset type is defined by a content-type "com.esri.mo2.data.feat.FeatureDataset". Content-types are usually published as the names of interfaces rather than classes. Both getData() and isContentTypeAvailable() work with a class hierarchy in the following way. If a content-type (class name) is specified that matches exactly with one exposed by getAvailableContentTypes() then appropriate results are returned. If not, then the Content will determine if the required content-type is a generalization of the available content-types, and the first one found will constitute a match. For example, if the Content represents a shapefile, and the exposed types are FeatureDataset, FeatureClass and FeatureLayer, and if the calling code requests a type "com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Dataset" (in that order) then the Content returned will be the FeatureDataset, since both FeatureDataset and FeatureClass are special cases of Dataset, but FeatureDataset was exposed first. But if, with the same Content, the request is for "com.esri.mo2.data.feat.MapDataset", then FeatureClass will be returned. Finally, if the request is for "com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.GraphicsLayer" then null will be returned, because FeatureLayer does not extend GraphicsLayer though they are both of type Layer.

Content implements Comparable, so that arrays of Contents can be sorted - the default ordering is expected to be a case-independent sorting by name.

createConnection

public Connection createConnection()
constructs a Connection to the Source that created this Content.

Returns:
the Connection or null if this Content not created through a Connection.

getName

public String getName()
obtain the name of this Content. Each Content object is expected to have a unique name within its containing Folder

obtain the path that uniquely references this Content within the associated Source

getParent

public Folder getParent()
obtain the containing Folder. A "root" Folder has no parent.

Returns:
the parent Folder, or null if root Folder

setParent

public void setParent(Folder parent)
set the parent Folder - used by Folders

getDescription

public String getDescription()
obtain a one or two word description of the content type. This will be used by the Catalog for display purposes, and is expected to be defined within the ResourceBundle.

getIcon

public Image getIcon()
obtain a representative icon, for use with the user interface Catalog. It should optimally be 15x15 pixels

Returns:
the image icon
See Also:
Catalog

getProperties

public Properties getProperties()
obtain descriptive properties for this Content. The keys for this HashMap are expected to be Strings defined in the ResourceBundle

               throws IOException
obtain Content data for the given content type

Parameters:

Returns:
the data, or null == no data available for the specified content type

isContentTypeAvailable

public boolean isContentTypeAvailable(String type)
determine if the specified content-type is available

Parameters:
type - a Content-type identifier
Returns:
true == the content-type is available, false == otherwise
See Also:
getAvailableContentTypes()

getAvailableContentTypes

public String[] getAvailableContentTypes()
obtain all the content types exposed through this Content. Each content type string is an identifier for the types this Content can represent. The return value is always expected to be an array. If there are no Content types available, then an empty array can be expected - not a null return value.

Returns:
an array of content type strings, empty array == no content types
